html:
Name: _______________Class: _______________StatisticsPro
Date: _______________Score: ___/100Grade 10-12

style: font-family: 'Spectral', serif; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; color: #2c3e50; margin-bottom: 5mm;
font-family: 'Spectral', serif; font-size: 18px; font-weight: 500; text-align: center; color: #5a6c7d; font-style: italic; margin-bottom: 8mm;

html: 1) Find the mean of the data set: $\{5, 8, 12, 15, 20\}$

2) Calculate the standard deviation of the data: $\{2, 4, 6, 8, 10\}$
Formula: $\sigma = \sqrt{\frac{\sum(x_i - \mu)^2}{n}}$
3) A fair six-sided die is rolled. What is the probability of rolling a number greater than 4?
4) In a normal distribution with mean $\mu = 50$ and standard deviation $\sigma = 10$, what percentage of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean?
5) Two cards are drawn from a standard deck without replacement. What is the probability that both cards are hearts?
6) Find the median and mode of the data set: $\{3, 7, 7, 9, 12, 15, 15, 15, 18\}$

7) A binomial experiment has $n = 10$ trials and probability of success $p = 0.3$. Find $P(X = 2)$
Formula: $P(X = k) = \binom{n}{k} p^k (1-p)^{n-k}$
8) Given the correlation coefficient $r = 0.85$ between two variables, describe the strength and direction of the linear relationship.
